definition:
Suppose that ${\mathbb{C}}$ is the complex plane and
$G \subset {\mathbb{C}}$. The [*extended boundary*]{} of $G$ denoted
$\partial_\infty G$ is defined as the boundary of $G$ plus the point at
infinity if in fact $G$ is unbounded.

The extended boundary of $G$ is really the boundary of $G$ in the
extended complex plane (the one-point compactification of
${\mathbb{C}}$).

[9]{} John B. Conway. [**]{}. Springer-Verlag, New York, New York, 1978.
